results.title: A Building survives: Olderfleet
results.brief_description: Features an interview with the architects and/or builders who renovated the Olderfleet building in Collins Street, Melbourne without destroying its original facade. From the ABC television program “This Day Tonight” October 1973.

results.title: A Brother for Susan
results.creator_credit: Winifred Holmes, Oswald Skilbeck and Southalls Ltd
results.brief_description: An account of the processes of human gestation from fertilization to the birth of a child. The film answers many question which arise in the mind of a fourteen-year-old child. Shows the visits of the mother to a baby clinic; explains how the human egg is fertilized; how menstruation ceases; the creation of the embryo, its growth to a nine-month baby, and its ultimate delivery.

results.title: Music for the movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
Aaron Copland, famed American composer-pianist, narrates and conducts his own film musical scores. Copland has chosen music from “Red Pony”, “Our Town” and “Something Wild” as a framework in which to show the purpose and meaning of background scores for motion pictures. Featuring the New York Philharmonic.

results.title: 800 miles of winter (TEFC)
results.brief_description: From the discovery of oil at Prudhoe Bay in 1968 to the loading of the first tankers at Valdez in 1977, this is the story of one of the most difficult and costly construction projects ever attempted. Almost 800 miles of big pipe was laid across three major mountain ranges and Arctic perma-frost, to reach an ice free port in south east Alaska. (Award: Golden Eagle, USA)

results.title: 3,000 Years of Conflict
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
Breathtaking in scope,”3,000 Years of Conflict” traces India’s turbulent history from the Aryan invaders in 1500 BC to Independence in 1947.

results.title: 700 Million Faces
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a land of contradictions. Mrs. Ghandi discusses in an in-depth yet light-hearted and often amusing interview, India’s contemporary and greatly diversified lifestyles.

results.title: In the name of love
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
It has only been in the past decade or so that many Indian women have taken a definite step towards “Liberation” but despite the fact that a few women have played major roles in government these ladies are few in number, considering the population. The majority are still treated as inferiors, and appear to be completely self-effacing. This modern day ‘modesty’ seems an anachronism considering the role love and equality have played in the history and culture of this exotic land. This film explores the folklore and mythology of love in India.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
